headline: Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars
description: This oatmeal cookie bar recipe is easy to make with seedless raspberry jam sandwiched between buttery brown sugar-oat cookie crusts for a sweet treat.

video.description: Easy jammy cookie bars are the best!
video.name: Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars

name: Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch square pan; line with greased foil.
Combine flour, oats, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Rub in butter using your hands or a pastry blender to form a crumbly mixture.
Press 2 cups oat mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan. Spread jam to within 1/4 inch of the edge. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture on top; press down lightly into jam.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes. Allow to cool before cutting into bars.

review.reviewBody: These are awesome. I made once as is and they were delicious. The next time I made them, I added chopped pecans to the oatmeal mixture and added on top of the jam some frozen raspberries that I froze from fresh and then thawed. YUM!!! everyone that has had these bars loves them. Thank you for such a great recipe.
very easy to make when in a rush. delicious and crowd pleasing. loved it
We absolutely love these bars I make them at least twice a month . They are so easy to put together great with tea or as a dessert served with ice cream .

These are so simple and were a hit with my son and friends (not to mention me!). I used lightly sweetened strawberry freezer jam (I made it when I had too many strawberries). We don't actually used jellies or jams normally so I was excited to make use of it. I'm actually making two more batches right now. This time I'm issuing my homemade apple sauce for one and the other will be my homemade cranberry sauce left over from the holidays. Both were in my freezer so I figured why not. I did make two alterations. I added some yummy Saigon cinnamon and I cut the butter in half and added avacado oil. I couldn't tell the difference. This time I'm going to use half coconut oil and half avocado oil. I wouldn't attempt the coconut oil if I didn't already know my family doesn't mind the slight flavor.

My family absolutely loved these bars the first time I made this recipe. The second time I made these I was low on quick oats so I subbed 1/2 cup of oats with 1/2 cup shredded coconut… and it was a success!! I would 100% recommend this change
No changes to recipe except baked the bottom crust for 15 minutes before putting jam and remaining top mixture on it to make it crunchier.

I love this recipe. I made a special version for Christmas with 4 fruit jam (including raspberry), pomegranate seeds, and lots of dark chocolate. It turned out delicious, but the ooey gooey chocolate jam seed layer did make some of the outer edge pieces look a bit less neat and tidy.

I've made these several times and really like that ingredients are aways in the pantry. I've used several different types of jam - raspberry, blackberry. Today, I decided to use a jar of lingonberries that's been on my shelf for a long time. I've never tried it previously, so I tasted a little bit before using on the cookies. It was fabulous! A little tart and a bit more assertive in taste than the other jams. Definitely my favorite of all flavors I've tried. I'm told you can get it Ikea, although I think I bought it from Vitacost on a whim.
This was a simple recipe to put together. My husband loved it!

The first time I made these I used my hands to combine the mixture and it kind of came out like wet glop. A delicious wet glop but wet glop none the less. Using a pastry blender is the way. It was accidentally made with strawberry jam once and it was not the same. Another time I had someone make it for me and they used less jam and it was not as good. The recipe is a NO CHANGE!
I made these for our Mahjongg group. They liked them as did I. They weren’t too rich. I used my homemade jam.

I made these for the first time for a bachelorette party. Wow, did they love them! So many compliments and now I have to bring them to the wedding too! I doubled the recipe and used an 18 oz. jar of the raspberry preserves and a little less sugar in the other part. I think these are my new go to cookie/bar.

Made this recipe today. I did not want to buy a whole jar of raspberry jam just for a recipe, so I just used the strawberry jam I already had in the fridge. I also added a 1/4 cup of shredded coconut. MMMMM!!!! These bars are delicious! I will definitely make them again! And again!
These are delicious! My whole family enjoyed them!
These were delicious! I have a really big sweet tooth though, so I drizzled white chocolate on top for a little added sweetness. Perfection!
Delicious!

Doubled the crust ingredients for a 9 x 13 pan. Toasted the oats in a dry saute pan before mixing. Didn't have raspberry jam, but made a jam from frozen blueberries. Great recipe. Would work with any fruit jam. This is a keeper.
I did strawberry jam and it came out really good.
Very good, made it once with raspberry and once with blueberry jam. I had to add more butter just to get the bottom oatmeal mixture cooperate.

I love how simple this recipe is!! Everytime I have a sweet craving, I make these Oat Bars. My whole family loves them too. I've learned to put the jam in the microwave for a few seconds and add a touch of water to thin it out before you spread your jam layer.

Four stars because I didn’t want to use jelly . I think most of the complaints about sticking was because of the jam/jelly. This recipe was, however, the perfect setting for the changes I made . I made my own raspberry pie filling and added a bit of cinnamon and crushed up pecans to the topping . Used a 1/2 sheet baking pan and voila, perfection! Thank you for sharing this recipe!
These are so good. I made with blueberry preserves and added a 1/2 cup of freshly picked blueberries on top of the preserves

Liked the recipe made some small modifications all modifications added a tablespoon of lime juice to the bonne maman , Raspberry jam add less than a 1/8th of a teaspoon Ceylon cinnamon to the crumble mix. Added diced pecan haves to the crumble on top.
Requested frequently by family and friends who’ve enjoyed it. That’s the best endorsement. It’s delish exactly as written.
This recipe was so easy and the results so good. Only addition was sprinkling confectioners sugar on top a few minutes after removing from the oven.

I made these for the 4th of July this year and my family loved them. They are so easy to make and easy to adapt too. My family eats dairy free and soy free for allergies and I subbed Kite Hill brand DF/SF butter for real butter and it worked perfectly. I will sub the raspberry filling for peach today. I use the organic variety from Trader Joes and read the ingredients carefully for mostly fruit not mostly sugar. The healthier ones are called "spread" not jam or preserves. I love simple recipes that are easy and kind of healthy too.
Loved the recipe, no changes.

Had to use combo of blackberry &. Raspberry jam so they didn’t have the needed tang.. maybe a bit of kosher salt would have been good. Bars have a pretty good texture.. might make again with apricot jam.

Rich, but delicious I just had smaller pieces with my coffee.
Super quick to make.
So easy to make and yummy. Great recipe to make with a child.

I turned them into raspberry almond bars simply by adding 1/2 tsp almond extract to the preserves, sprinkled the top with sliced almonds. When they were done, I made a glaze with 1/2 c powdered sugar and 1/2 t almond extract and drizzled it on top. 
Great base recipe and very versatile!
I made a strawberry jam and used that. Its pretty darn good. I’d have liked more of that jam

I made this last night and it turned out great!! I followed others advice and really combined the butter into the oatmeal well, using my hands. I used seeded jam and it tasted great. I also sprinkled a handful of chocolate chips on top of the jam and added some pecans to the top crumble. 33 minutes at 350 degrees in a 8x8 square pan.
We love this recipe- I cut the jam to 1/2 cup and add a handful of fresh berries. It adds a little bit of tartness to cut the sweetness of the jam. So easy to make and taste delicious.
I only had papaya jam (& added a bit of chopped papaya) & they were great!! A definite keeper, easy & delicious!
I have made these a few times and each time they have come out excellent. Quick recipe with small number of ingredients. Taste liked you baked all day!
Very filling; definitely more of a dessert recipe than breakfast bars. Very delicious! Brought them to a party to rave reviews. Would make again for special occasions.
These are delicious! They disappear in record time when I make them.
I have made this many, many times as written. I usually use seedless jam if available. A family favorite now, and as my son says, “It hits”

I made no changes and this was absolutely delicious! One thing that I did have a small issue with was I only had jam with seeds. To fix this I warmed it up for 30 seconds and pressed it through a strainer. Worked well. I definitely recommend to everyone!!
Unbelievably delicious! With this recipe you could use a variety of jams. Such a treat. I can’t show a photo because they were eaten so fast!

3.16.21 ... Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars ...A little less jam next time. It made them a bit too soft/loose. I cut softened margarine in; then, smeared with the back of a spoon, stirred & repeated to incorporate. Greased a glass 8x8 without foil & all was good. Repeatable.
Delicious, love the raspberry in the middle!!
These are just delicious and a great relatively guilt-free sweet snack.

Wow, easy delicious, will make again. Used hot pepper jelly at bought at the local market for a little fun. I would use it again Yummy. I’d say I made no changes, but I made an error using one whole batch for the bottom layer which required I make an additional 1/2 batch for top layer. I’m blaming the new kitchen for this delicious error.
Great recipe! I used reduced sugar cherry preserves and whole frozen cherries instead, which made them almost taste like cherry pie. Yum!
Delicious and super easy to make. I will cut back on the sugar next time because the jam is sweet enough
This was great, I added walnuts. Will make again
My whole family loved them :D
I made this. Read the reviews and hoped for the best. Well, it doesn't hold together, very crumbly. It takes good, but it doesn't hold together as a bar as I had hoped. Sad face.
My husband enjoyed it. Tasted better on 2nd day. I made it exactly as per recipe but I will adjust topping next time since I found it very messy and tad dry.
Quick and easy recipe that is a favorite of all that have tasted! I use Oregon Marionberry jam and add melted butter to the topping to help with the crumbling.
I've been making these cookie bars for a few years. I use my homemade jam, which has a lot less sugar than store bought jams. I usually add 1/4 cup of chopped pecans to the crust mixture.
Just made this with stevia/brown sugar blend, English walnuts and sugar free blackberry jelly. Was delicious! Soft, crunchy and flavorful. I'll be adding this to my recipe stash.
Made it exactly as written, came out perfectly. My go to recipe for raspberry bars!
Made it as written plus a tsp of cinnamon. It's sweet, of course, but the oat layer is tasty. I can imagine using a lower sugar fruit spread but it probably would be even crumblier.

Been making these every late summer for years now. Easy, tastes good, kids love it, husband loves it. I use store bought seedless raspberry jam because our family *haaaaates* seeds in jam. Also good warmed up with a dollop of vanilla ice cream on top.
Delicious. Wouldn't change a thing
One of my favorites! I recommend adding a full cup of jam, but if you have fresh or frozen raspberries I like to make a sauce rather than a jam. Overall one of my best recipes!

The best oatmeal fruited bar recipe! I make small modifications (I’m gluten free), add a handful of fresh berries on top... I’ve done raspberry, blueberry... various kinds always yummy and guests devour them!

I have made these bars 3 times now. It has quickly become a family favorite. I am gluten free and it converts beautifully. I have found that the texture of the oatmeal mix is better if you use your hands to rub in the butter rather than the pastry cutter. At least that is the opinion of both my family and me.

Very good, I did not make any changes, other than adding a bit of lemon zest as another reviewer suggested. Next time I may try adding an egg to a double batch and cutting the sugar a bit as it was just a tad sweet for my taste. Had to eat with a fork but was absolutely yummy.
I made these for my daughter except I used fresh raspberries and added blueberries. Turned out so good my daughter is pestering me to make them again.
This is the second time I've made this. Both times they came out crumbly but taste great. I added extra butter (1T) this time hoping to get it to stay together but still crumbles.
I made these using the foil, never again, they stuck to the foil even after spraying with Pam, they crumbled up as I was trying to remove them from the foil lined pan
i made these and my mom said she wanted to marry them and that my grandmother would be so proud of me so if that doesn’t prove that these are amazing i don’t know what does
These are so easy to make and everyone love them! You can use any jam or even canned cranberry sauce. I can only make these if I have a group or people to share them with.
Loved it!
Made them last night and again today when the grandkids came over, there were none left from night before. Love them.
Delish! Great recipe. I will try with other fruits.

Love these! Works with quick oats if you don't have rolled. I added nutmeg, thinking I should add some vanilla extract next time or even almonds, there's so many possibilities for these. It's not as sweet as a chocolate chip cookie or anything so if you're looking for something especially sweet this probably isn't the recipe for you but that's what I like so much about it - the fact that it ISN'T overly sweet, as so many desserts are. My kids think they're getting a treat without being overloaded with sugar

I made the recipe as recommended - it was delicious! Loved the texture but I found it a little too sweet for my liking. Next time I will be trying some of the recommended alternatives. Will definitely be making again.

I LOVE this recipe I always double it and make a 9 x 13 pan. Have used raspberry, apricot and cherry reserves. All are delicious. An absolute favorite my house and among my friends. Always use Quaker Old Fashioned Oats. I used an off brand once and texture was not as good

I’m new too baking with the exception of cheesecake (my go to) I made these twice now, once with blackberry jam and once with strawberry and omg they are so good! They will be my go to from now on. I’m baking for 100+ every day during quarantine 2020 and I’m pretty sure these will be made several times. In fact my friend said “im thinking about going down to pretend I’m homeless just so I can get one” I just made a batch to share with friends because they are that easy!!!
So delicious and easy. I had a bunch of raspberries that were about to go over so I made a compote to use instead of jelly. Will make
A little too sweet for me, so next time will use less sugar, but the flavor and texture were perfect.
Mine were a bit dry. I will use less oats & more butter next time I make them

These were so good. I didn't have raspberry jam, so used my homemade apricot jam. To make spreading jam easier I heated up the jam in the microwave for about 45 seconds, gave it a stir then spread it over the base crust. I will be making these again.
I used margarine instead of butter and they turned out great. Next time I will increase the jam by ½ again. My family loved them

Perfect as is. So simple and quick. I used grape jelly (it's all I had), added pecans and small amount of butterscotch chips only because they were in my pantry. I like the small batch so I can make them over and over again with variations. I can see variations with vanilla, coconut, any nut, any fruit, cream cheese. Or just as is!

Delicious is right! we really enjoyed these.

I used Bob's Red Mill quick cooking steel cuts oats since that is what I had. otherwise, made it as written. 

 I made my own jam using 2 cups of frozen raspberries and 1 cup sugar. boil and stir constantly for 8 minutes. Added some lemon juice (@2 tsp?).

Not sure what else to say. These were easy and yummy! will make again!

Delicious is right! we really enjoyed these.

I used Bob's Red Mill quick cooking steel cuts oats since that is what I had. otherwise, made it as written. 

 I made my own jam using 2 cups of frozen raspberries and 1 cup sugar. boil and stir constantly for 8 minutes. Added some lemon juice (@2 tsp?).

Not sure what else to say. These were easy and yummy! will make again!

Delicious! I used no sugar added seedless raspberry jelly and followed the recipe exactly as written. I also lined my pan with lightly greased aluminum foil (which made is super easy to lift out the bars after baking). These turned out great!
this was really yummy and easy to make, i let some sit for a day and the jam absored into it making it taste way better
Much better than expected. Added a smidgen more preserves for sweetness

This is a great recipe, and so easy! I didn’t alter the recipe, although I did double it in order to fill a 9x13 pan- and I’m so glad I did because they have been a hit! The bars are great straight out of the oven, room temp, or chilled- and taste like the Brambleberry crisp flavor from Jeni’s ice cream- just without the ice cream. Def would recommend!

Wonderful. Easy and delicious. I used my food processor to combine the four mixture with butter. I was careful to only pulse it until a crumble just began to form.

Next time I’ll “gild the lily” and add some fresh berries on top of the jam. This recipe is going into my “make often” file. BTW, freezes well, too! A perfect little fruit square all around.
Big hit with my picky kids!
Pack more batter on the bottom for a firmer base, not much is needed for the crumble on top.
I didn't like. It took much more time to bake it as the top was too soft per recipe instructions
I doubled the recipe and used a 9x12” glass baking dish. Baked for 35 mins. Came out great! Made this for a super bowl party and everybody loved it. Very little clean up and quick to make.

These are so good! The crust is my favorite part because it's buttery and a little crunchy, mmmm!! Melt in your mouth. So easy too. If you haven't tried these with cherry preserves yet give it a go!! It's amazing! Also turns out well with 1 cup of gluten free flour instead of regular and 1/4 tsp of xantham gum.
OMG...this is crack! Makes a small amount and it's so amazingly good. Use parchment paper -helps to lift it out. Delicious warm!
Made no changes from recipe. Quick and easy and delicious!
Easy and very tasty! This is going toward the top of my "goodies" recepe file! Thank you for sharing. As always, made exactly as written....
Substituted the raspberry jam with apple butter, added a layer of fresh blueberries, topped with the final crumble section. Baked for 30 minutes.

I love these and they are always a hit when I make them! I make exactly according to the recipe. Thanks for a great bar cookie that isn't chocolate! I also did not use seedless jam and thought they were perfect.
I used the leftover homemade cranberry sauce from thanksgiving, and it was great. Kids loves it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.
Will definitely make again. Easy to make and experimenting with different jams might make it a 5.
